title: Surface BOP Well Control Decisions
description: Well control decision-making specific to surface BOP operations - different considerations from subsea

scenario.context: You are drilling at {{currentDepth}} m on a land rig with surface BOP. Mud weight is {{mudWeight}} sg. You've just completed a connection and noticed a {{pitGain}} bbl pit gain during flow check.

questions.question: You've confirmed a {{pitGain}} bbl kick and shut in on the surface BOP. SIDPP is {{shutInDrillPipePressure}} psi and SICP is {{shutInCasingPressure}} psi. Calculate your kill mud weight and explain your kill method selection.
keyPoints: Wait and Weight vs Driller's Method selection
Surface BOP advantage - direct choke access
questions.correctResponse: Kill MW = Current MW + (SIDPP / (0.052 Ã— TVD)). For surface BOP, Wait and Weight is typically preferred as we have direct choke access without riser complications. Verify MAASP at shoe before circulating. Key advantage over subsea: faster response time, no choke line friction losses, direct visual monitoring at BOP.

questions.question: During the kill operation, casing pressure is approaching MAASP. What are your options and how does surface BOP give you more flexibility than subsea?
keyPoints: No choke line friction to account for
questions.correctResponse: Options: 1) Reduce pump rate (reduces AFP, lowers casing pressure), 2) Apply volumetric method if gas migration is issue, 3) Bullheading - easier on surface BOP with direct pump access. Surface BOP advantages: No choke line friction losses (can be 500+ psi on subsea), faster choke response, ability to visually monitor BOP, easier access for repairs if needed.

questions.question: You're on a land rig in remote location. During well control, your hydraulic choke fails. What's your contingency and how do you maintain well control?
questions.correctResponse: Immediate switch to manual choke operation. Ensure driller maintains constant bottomhole pressure using pump strokes and manual choke adjustment. If manual choke also problematic: 1) Consider pump and bleed method, 2) Maintain well shut in while organizing repair, 3) Contact base for emergency equipment. Land rig consideration: spare parts may be hours away - always verify backup equipment before operations.
